name: HIP 5158
scenarioDescription:
The HIP 5158 Exoplanetary System

HIP 5158 is a star with 0.78 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.875 times its radius. It is located 168.56 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 6 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HIP 5158 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

HIP 5158 b

HIP 5158 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its discovery was announced in 2010-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.89 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 345.72 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, HIP 5158.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.52, which means that when HIP 5158 b is at is at its closest point to its host star, 0.43 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 1.35. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of HIP 5158 b is 451.29 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HIP 5158 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.

HIP 5158 c

HIP 5158 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its discovery was announced in 2011-09. Its semi-major axis is 7.70 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 9017.76 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, HIP 5158.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.14, which means that when HIP 5158 c is at is at its closest point to its host star, 6.62 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 8.78. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of HIP 5158 c is 4779.87 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HIP 5158 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HIP 5158, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by La Silla Observatory.
